Tour.Title: Educator's Tour
Tour.Description: A tour introducing WorldWide Telescope to students and educators in formal and informal settings.
Tour.Author: Lisa Dettloff

Tour.Title: Interactive Tours
Tour.Description: This tour illustrates the interactive possibilities of Tours within WorldWide Telescope
Tour.Author: Curtis Wong

Tour.Title: WWT Equinox Overview
Tour.Description: A brief overview of selected features in the new Equinox Beta release
Tour.Author: Curtis WOng

Tour.Title: Create a tour
Tour.Description: A quick demonstration illustrating how to create a guided tour.
Tour.Author: Microsoft

Tour.Title: Using the Observing Time pane
Tour.Description: A brief introduction to the Observing Time pane and how to use it when creating a slide that shows elapsed time, such as when showing a solar or lunar eclipse.
Tour.Author: Microsoft

Tour.Title: Making a constellation figure
Tour.Description: This tour will demonstrate how to use the Figure Library to make your own constellation stick figures.
Tour.Author: Microsoft

Tour.Title: Using the Image Crossfade
Tour.Description: This is a brief demonstration of how to use the Image Crossfade slider and the fascinating stuff that you can discover when you compare images from different spectral studies.
Tour.Author: Microsoft

Tour.Title: Orion Nebula - Hubble's Universe
Tour.Description: Star and planet formation in the Orion Nebula as shown in images from the Hubble Space Telescope.
Tour.Author: Dr. Frank Summers

Tour.Title: Seeing the Invisible
Tour.Description: Explore the Universe through the eyes of NASA's Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (WISE) spacecraft. WISE surveyed the entire sky in infrared light.
Tour.Author: Nancy Alima Ali
Tour.OrganizationName: Center for Science Education, Space Sciences Lab, University of California Berkeley

Tour.Title: W5 star forming region
Tour.Description: Multiple Generations of Star Forming in W5 region from Spitzer Space Telescope. Tour produced by Lori Allen< Xavier Koenig and Sanjana Sharma.
Tour.Author: Lori Allen, Xavier Koenig, Sanjana Sharma
Tour.OrganizationName: Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, Spitzer Space Telescope

Tour.Title: The Ring Nebula
Tour.Description: A 6 year olds journey to the jewel of the sky
Tour.Author: Benjamin

Tour.Title: The Eagle Nebula
Tour.Description: A tour by David a 5th grade student from Issaquah Washington
Tour.Author: David

Tour.Title: Dust & Us
Tour.Description: A brief tour of the dark regions in galaxies that form stars and planets. For more information and video clips related to this tour, click on the link to the PBS NOVA Dust and Us site below.
Tour.Author: Alyssa Goodman, Curtis Wong & Pat Udomprasert

Tour.Title: Beautiful Nebulas
Tour.Description: These are beautiful nebulas that I hope you enjoy seeing.
Tour.Author: Microsoft

Tour.Title: Eta Carina Nebula
Tour.Description: A brief tour of the Eta Carina Nebula from the Hubble Advanced Camera for Surveys.
Tour.Author: Curtis WOng

Tour.Title: Chandra Crab Nebula
Tour.Description: The X-Ray view of the Crab Nebula from the Great Observatories.
Tour.Author: Megan Watzke

Tour.Title: Universal Beauty
Tour.Description: A universe of beautiful objects.
Tour.Author: High Skies

Tour.Title: Center of the Milky Way
Tour.Description:
Tour of the radio wavelength view of the inner Galaxy. We start by reviewing all-sky views in various wavelenghts and then zoom into a radio view of Sagittarius A and finally into Sagittarius A*, the location of the supermassive black hole at the Galactic Center.
Credit: Tour and Narration - Doug Roberts, Music - Robert Fripp.
Tour.Author: Doug Roberts

Tour.Title: Seven top galaxies
Tour.Description: Amateur astronomers love to observe galaxies. Although you need a dark site, you can spot some galaxies even through small telescopes. This tour shows you seven of the sky's finest galaxies.
Tour.Author: Michael E. Bakich

Tour.Title: M82 Cigar Galaxy
Tour.Description: Tour of M82 from the Hidden Universe
Tour.Author: Robert Hurt

Tour.Title: Dust & Us
Tour.Description: A brief tour of the dark regions in galaxies that form stars and planets. For more information and video clips related to this tour, click on the link to the PBS NOVA Dust and Us site below.
Tour.Author: Alyssa Goodman, Curtis Wong & Pat Udomprasert

Tour.Title: Galaxy M81
Tour.Description: An infrared tour of M81 Galaxy in Ursa Major from the Spitzer Space Telescope
Tour.Author: Curtis WOng

Tour.Title: Impact with M31
Tour.Description: This tour discusses the Milky Way's pending collision with the Andromeda Galaaxy (M31).
Tour.Author: Francis Reddy

Tour.Title: Interesting Objects
Tour.Description: A quick look at interesting places in the sky
Tour.Author: Curtis WOng

Tour.Title: Sombrero Galaxy
Tour.Description: A tour of the Sombrero Galaxy
Tour.Author: Megan Watzke

Tour.Title: John Huchra's Universe
Tour.Description: This Tour is offered as a tribute to John Huchra by his friends and admirers at the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics and Microsoft Research.
Tour.Author: Alyssa Goodman, Curtis Wong & Pat Udomprasert

Tour.Title: Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope
Tour.Description: Tour of celestial objects studied by the Fermi gamma-ray space telescope.
Tour.Author: Kamal S. Prasad

Tour.Title: Terapixel
Tour.Description: A qucik look at the new terapixel image of the sky.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: TED
Tour.Description: TED presentation by Roy Gould Feb 27th 2008, Monterey CA
Tour.Author: Roy Gould

Tour.Title: Gamma-ray Sources
Tour.Description: An exploration of the invisible universe, travel through the galaxy and out to discover the nature of gamma-ray radiation.
Tour.Author: Nick McColl for the VERITAS Collaboration

Tour.Title: The X-Ray Sky
Tour.Description: A brief tour of the X-Ray sky and a look at sources of high energy X-Rays
Tour.Author: Curtis Wong

Tour.Title: Interesting Objects
Tour.Description: A quick look at interesting places in the sky
Tour.Author: Curtis WOng

Tour.Title: Many worlds tour
Tour.Description: A tour of multiple worlds. The Earth, Venus, Mars plus Jupiter and its four major moons.
Tour.Author: Jonathan Fay

Tour.Title: Galileo's New Order
Tour.Description: An interactive explanation of why Galileo's telescopic observations of Jupiter and its moons, in 1610, is so important in the history of astrophysics.
Tour.Author: Alyssa Goodman, Curtis Wong & Pat Udomprasert

Tour.Title: Gas Giants
Tour.Description: A tour of the visible features of the Gas Giants: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: WWT - Mars Introductory Tour
Tour.Description: A snappy overivew of the Mars release of WorldWide Telescope.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Life on Mars?
Tour.Description: Dr. Carol Stoker, Co-Investigator on the Mars Phoenix Mission, discusses the possibility that we may one day find microbial life on Mars.
Tour.Author: NASA

Tour.Title: The Ages of Mars
Tour.Description: Dr. Jim Garvin describes the geologic ages of Mars as well as potential landing sites for the human exploration of Mars.
Tour.Author: NASA

Tour.Title: Search for Extra Solar Planets
Tour.Description: Explains how astronomers are able to detect extrasolar planets and some findings from the TrES project and the promise of the Kepler telescope. Narrated and produced by Sanjana Sharma.
Tour.Author: David Charbonneau

Tour.Title: Surface Features of Mars
Tour.Description: A look at the named surface features of Mars - including craters, mountains, valleys, landslides and much more. The astro-geological terms for the features is given in the narration, as Mars is explored and found to be a varied and exciting place.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: IO Surface Tour
Tour.Description: A tour of the innermost of the Galilaen moons. IO is the most geologically active body in the solar system, with a constantly changing surface.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Part II: Surface Features of Mars
Tour.Description: The concluding part of our tour of the surface features of Mars.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Ganymede Surface Tour
Tour.Description: A tour of the surface of the largest moon in the Solar System - Ganymede. Ganymede is very similar in composition to Europa, but differs significantly in appearance.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: The Ages of Mars
Tour.Description: Dr. Jim Garvin describes the geologic ages of Mars as well as potential landing sites for the human exploration of Mars.
Tour.Author: NASA

Tour.Title: Surface Features of Callisto
Tour.Description: A tour of the distinctive surface features of the outermost of the four Galilean moons - Callisto.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Apollo Missions 12 to 14 (Part 2 of 3)
Tour.Description:
Walkthroughs of landing site panoramas of Apollo Missions 12 through 14.
Credits: Tour - Benjamin Steinhorn, Music - Robert Fripp.
Tour.Author: bsteinho@mit.edu

Tour.Title: Earth @ Night
Tour.Description: One of my favourite NASA maps of our planet is the "Earth at Night", available at the NASA Visible Earth site made by Marc Imhoff (NASA GSFC), Christopher Elvidge (NOAA NGDC), Craig Mayhew & Robert Simmon (NASA GSFC). Music by Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com).
Tour.Author: Dino Surendran

Tour.Title: Asteroids
Tour.Description: A tour of the asteroids in the Solar System - looking at the asteroid belt, the Trojans of Jupiter and Neptune, and a look at the varied elliptical orbits of the asteroids.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Apollo Missions 15 to 17 (Part 3 of 3)
Tour.Description:
Walkthroughs of landing site panoramas of Apollo Missions 15 through 17.
Credits: Tour - Benjamin Steinhorn, Music - Robert Fripp.
Tour.Author: Benjamin Steinhorn

Tour.Title: Pluto
Tour.Description: A visit to Pluto using WWT's new 3D mode, showing some of the reasons why it was reclassified as a dwarf planet.
Tour.Author: Dino Surendran

Tour.Title: Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter
Tour.Description: A quick look at LRO's six main instruments. Credit: Tour - Benjamin Steinhorn. Music - Robert Fripp.
Tour.Author: Benjamin Steinhorn

Tour.Title: Surface Features of Europa
Tour.Description: A tour of the distinctive surface features of this icy moon.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Mars Landings
Tour.Description: A review of surface landing efforts on Mars
Tour.Author: Joan Clara Smith

Tour.Title: AdiÃ³s Phoenix
Tour.Description: A brief description of the Phoenix Lander Mission. It was launched by NASA on 4 August 2007, landed on Mars on 25 May 2008, and ended on 10 November 2008.
Tour.Author: Dino Surendran

Tour.Title: Lunar Recon. Orbiter Camera
Tour.Description:
A tour about Arizona State University's camera on board NASA's Lunar Reconnaissance orbiter.
Credit: Tour - Joan Clara Smith, Music - Robert Fripp.
Tour.Author: Joan Clara Smith

Tour.Title: First Pictures of ExtraSolar Planets
Tour.Description: On 13 November 2008, two groups using the Keck/Gemini telescope and the Hubble Telescope announced the first images of planets orbiting stars other than our Sun.
Tour.Author: Dino Surendran

Tour.Title: Venus Surface
Tour.Description: The surface of Venus has been mapped by radar, and this tour visits some ot the highlights.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Moons of Mars
Tour.Description: A qucik tour of the two tiny moons, Phobos and Diemos, that orbit Mars.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: The Apollo Program (1961-1975)
Tour.Description: A brief history of NASA's Apollo missions that landed humans on the moon in the 1960s and 1970s. Also shows off the animation capabilities of the WWT Equinox release.
Tour.Author: Dino Surendran

Tour.Title: Phases of the Moon
Tour.Description: From "Waxing Crescent" to "Waning Gibbous" this tour shows the different phases of the moon.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Aurora
Tour.Description: Sample interactive tour
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Many worlds tour
Tour.Description: A tour of multiple worlds. The Earth, Venus, Mars plus Jupiter and its four major moons.
Tour.Author: Jonathan Fay

Tour.Title: Opportunity on Mars
Tour.Description: Orbiting Mars and exploring Erebus crater.
Tour.Author: Curtis WOng

Tour.Title: Mercury Surface Tour
Tour.Description: A tour of the very old and heavily cratered surface of the innermost planet in our solar system.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Using the Image Crossfade
Tour.Description: This is a brief demonstration of how to use the Image Crossfade slider and the fascinating stuff that you can discover when you compare images from different spectral studies.
Tour.Author: Microsoft

Tour.Description: This Tour is offered as a tribute to John Huchra by his friends and admirers at the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics and Microsoft Research.

Tour.Title: Asteroids
Tour.Description: A tour of the asteroids in the Solar System - looking at the asteroid belt, the Trojans of Jupiter and Neptune, and a look at the varied elliptical orbits of the asteroids.

Tour.Title: Dark Matter at Abell 1689
Tour.Description: Description of Abell 1689 and the gravitational arcs attributed to dark matter.

Tour.Title: Center of the Milky Way
Tour.Description:
Tour of the radio wavelength view of the inner Galaxy. We start by reviewing all-sky views in various wavelenghts and then zoom into a radio view of Sagittarius A and finally into Sagittarius A*, the location of the supermassive black hole at the Galactic Center.

Tour.Author: Alyssa Goodman, Curtis Wong & Pat Udomprasert

Tour.Title: The First Black Hole
Tour.Description: The story of how astronomers combined two image sets, careful observations, and old-time detective work to prove the existence of black holes.
Tour.Author: Jordan Raddick

Tour.Title: Center of the Milky Way
Tour.Description:
Tour of the radio wavelength view of the inner Galaxy. We start by reviewing all-sky views in various wavelenghts and then zoom into a radio view of Sagittarius A and finally into Sagittarius A*, the location of the supermassive black hole at the Galactic Center.

Tour.Title: V838 - Light Echo
Tour.Description:
A sequence of images showing the V838 light Echo.
As the images are barely given time to download, it may need to be played through once first to cache all the images.

Tour.Title: Naked-eye open star clusters
Tour.Description: Here are several open star clusters that you can identify without binoculars or a telescope from a dark-sky site.

Tour.Title: Ancient Eye Test
Tour.Description: A short tour showing how an optical binary system in the Big Dipper was used in ancient times as a vision test.

Tour.Title: Binary stars

Tour.Description: Quick look at the August 21, 2017 Total Solar Eclipse across the continental United States in Summer.

Tour.Title: Aug 1, 2008 Eclipse

Tour.Title: 826 Seattle Tour
Tour.Description: In this field trip students voyage into space. While stopping in exciting locations, writers describe their journey, invent new traveling companions, take field notes, write postcards home, create poetry, brave the excitement and terror of unexpected emergencies and imagine either a return home, settlement in a new world or further travel.
Tour.Author: Alicia Craven and Curtis Wong

Tour.Title: Seven Summits
Tour.Description: A tour of the highest peak in each of the seven continents.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Volcanic Earth
Tour.Description: An introduction to the terminology of volcanism.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Avian Flu
Tour.Description: This tour shows the spread of Avian Flu during 2010.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Bathymetry
Tour.Description: An introductory tour of bathymetry data - the topographical features of the ocean floor.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Ring of Fire
Tour.Description: 2009 earthquake visualisation - set to music.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Earth @ Night
Tour.Description: One of my favourite NASA maps of our planet is the "Earth at Night", available at the NASA Visible Earth site made by Marc Imhoff (NASA GSFC), Christopher Elvidge (NOAA NGDC), Craig Mayhew & Robert Simmon (NASA GSFC). Music by Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com).
Tour.Author: Dino Surendran

Tour.Title: Siberia
Tour.Description: This is a tour about the landscape, history, and economy of Siberia.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Seeing the Invisible
Tour.Description: Explore the Universe through the eyes of NASA's Wide-field Infrared Survey Explorer (WISE) spacecraft. WISE surveyed the entire sky in infrared light.
Tour.Author: Nancy Alima Ali
Tour.OrganizationName: Center for Science Education, Space Sciences Lab, University of California Berkeley

Tour.Title: Educator's Tour
Tour.Description: A tour introducing WorldWide Telescope to students and educators in formal and informal settings.
Tour.Author: Lisa Dettloff

Tour.Title: Galileo's New Order
Tour.Description: An interactive explanation of why Galileo's telescopic observations of Jupiter and its moons, in 1610, is so important in the history of astrophysics.
Tour.Author: Alyssa Goodman, Curtis Wong & Pat Udomprasert

Tour.Title: Big Dipper GPS
Tour.Description: Learn to use the Big Dipper to find galaxies in the night sky.
Tour.Author: Mary J. Becker

Tour.Title: Scales_tour
Tour.Description: This tour explores the different scales of the Universe from the Earth to distant galaxies.
Tour.Author: Dr. Stella Offner

Tour.Title: W5 star forming region
Tour.Description: Multiple Generations of Star Forming in W5 region from Spitzer Space Telescope. Tour produced by Lori Allen< Xavier Koenig and Sanjana Sharma.
Tour.Author: Lori Allen, Xavier Koenig, Sanjana Sharma
Tour.OrganizationName: Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, Spitzer Space Telescope

Tour.Title: Our Lonely Sun: A Tour of Three Stars with Stellar Companions
Tour.Description: In this tour, we will take a look at some familiar stars in our night sky that are actually two or more stars together.
Tour.Author: Dr. Stella Offner

Tour.Title: The birth of a star like our sun
Tour.Description: Like us, our sun has a finite lifetime with a beginning and an end. In this tour we investigate how our sun formed.
Tour.Author: Dr. Stella Offner

Tour.Title: Phases of the Moon
Tour.Description: From "Waxing Crescent" to "Waning Gibbous" this tour shows the different phases of the moon.
Tour.Author: Peter Turcan

Tour.Title: Quick Tour of WWT
Tour.Description: Introduction to WorldWide Telescope
Tour.Author: Patricia Udomprasert & Jeremy Cushman
